speaker: Ice Bridge
lines: The bridge sings under your weight; a whale-song of ancient pressure.
Shapes move beneath the ice like memories trying to surface.
Hairline fractures web outward, silvering like spider silk in moonlight.
Air trapped centuries ago blooms from pinpricks, tasting of copper and rain.
A pale fish drifts below—no gills, no eyes—only a slow heartbeat of light.
You know, briefly and certainly, that this place knows your name.

choices.text: Cross quickly before the song crescendos.
Stop and peer into the depths.
